file_content.text: I am sad for you. For me. We all are lesser with her loss.
After all this time. To miss her by days...
Who is responsible for this woman's death?
What happened?
My condolences, ladies. I can't imagine what you must be feeling right now.
I'm sorry, Vette. Tivva.
Tivva? What happened?
Great. We come all the way out here and she's already dead.
Looks like a wasted trip.
What is wrong with you? Tivva? What's going on?
Ask him. It's his place, apparently.
Please, Lord, do not hurt me.
Not my shop, you know? I just run the shop for the illustrious Whuddle the Hutt. A slave is all I am. All she was.
She doesn't look that old. What killed her?
How did she die?
This is Tivva and Vette. She was their mother.
These are her daughters.
She spoke of you both. Not as living, though. Long ago she had given up hope...
If you are responsible for this I will choke the life out of your slave body.
Doesn't mean I won't kill you.
Please, it's not me. Not me ever. I do what I can to protect her, yes?
The great Whuddle the Hutt. He makes all do hard work. Carry many things. Only young, beautiful girls do not work.
They still work, believe me.
You mother was old. Led a hard life. I try to make her work easier but Whuddle's man whips me.
She carries stones for Whuddle's animal pens. For twenty hours she carries stones. Then she dies and I bring her here so she is not animal food.
You have laid her out here and cleaned her up. Now what?
Is there a funeral?
An old woman deserves her dignity. Even a slave.
That's terrible.
That's just what I thought. Just exactly.
Whuddle is within his rights to do with his slaves as he will.
Slaves are bought to work.
I never argued that. Just didn't want her to be animal food.
This is my mother we're talking about! She deserves some respect.
No credits for a ceremony. Nothing like that. Was going to put her in a hole out back. Stones on top will keep the animals out.
No. Here are some credits. Tell Whuddle's man I have paid for your time. Go to town and arrange the funeral.
I can pay for this. It's the least I can do.
Let me help with the expenses.
No. This is a family affair. And you've done too much for us already. Go.
I think we've shown we can survive just fine without your help. Go.
Yes, mistress.
Nicely done, Tivva. Even here, we'll give your mother the dignity she deserves.
Good plan.
I am officially overwhelmed.
I'll go now.
What are you waiting for? Get going, slave!
You heard her. Move!
Yes, my lord!
So much done. When it is twilight, the body will be cremated.
That was a lovely service. Still, I can't come to terms with it.
What? The fact that our mother was worked to death by a fat Hutt who's somewhere laughing about it right now?
You'll feel better once the Hutt lies dead at your feet.
Let's go kill the Hutt.
You can't expect to adjust to your mother's death immediately. You need time to process.
Grief takes time.
I think we've all had enough of this planet. Let's leave.
Maybe it's time to go.
Or maybe we need to go kill a Hutt. You, slave. How would we get in to see Whuddle?
There is no way the Sith would get in to see Whuddle. The Hutt fears the Sith and Jedi. Many many doors and locks.
The girls are beautiful, though. Mighty Whuddle would let them in.
I don't know, Tivva. You want to just go shoot this Hutt in the face?
Sometimes the only way to erase an injustice is to erase the person who committed it.
Revenge can help.
Don't just shoot him. Make sure it is long and painful.
Butcher the Hutt, Vette.
If you think it's the right thing to do...
Of course it's the right thing to do. Come on. Don't worry, we won't be long.
It is done. The Hutt dead... so much blood from so many.
Well that's done. Fat slug sure took his time dying. Feel bad that Feb got caught in the cross fire. Sweet old man.
My Moff is going to be worried. I'll see you two later. Better times.
Let's just go. Please? No talking.
You're not cut out for that sort of thing, Vette. You will die a little inside.
You don't want to do this.
You're right. You know my heart even better than I do.
And this from a Lord of the Sith. You're right, of course.
This is our mother we're talking about Ce'na! Our mother!
Let it go. There's been enough pain in this family.
Weak. Weak and cowardly. You are not my sister.
Let's go. Nothing left here.
I am just a simple slave.
